cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with the decoding of polar codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). It specifically focuses on the use of cyclic redundancy check (CRC) codes for error-correction, which is a topic in coding theory (cs.CC). The paper also discusses the use of factor graphs and belief propagation algorithms, which are commonly used in signal processing and machine learning (cs.SI). The optimization of permuted factor graphs is also mentioned, which is a topic in network information theory (cs.NI). Finally, the paper discusses the complexity of the decoding algorithms, which is a topic in distributed systems (cs.DS).
